subject: Data
title: Reproducibility and Open Code
description: A short lesson to help you apply Reproducibility and Open Code.

hook.text: A cancer researcher published results that couldn't be reproduced. The code and data were proprietary.

buildup.text: Open science advocates argue that both data and analysis code should be published alongside every paper.

discovery.text: Platforms like GitHub and Zenodo now let researchers share code and data permanently, with DOIs for citation.

twist.text: Many scientists resist. Sharing code exposes errors, and data sharing creates competition from better-funded labs.

climax.text: Journals increasingly require data and code sharing. The culture is shifting â€” slowly but irreversibly.

punchline.text: Science you can't check isn't science. It's a claim.

quiz.question: Why do some scientists resist sharing code and data?
options: It exposes errors and creates competition
